title.content-text: 5.2.1 IP Address Classes and Default Subnet Masks

brief.content-text:
Diagram 1, Image

The diagram depicts IP address classes.
Address Class: (A).
First octet range (decimal): 1 to 127.
First octet bits: 00000000 to 01111111.
Network and Host parts of an address: N.H.H.H.
Default subnet mask (decimal and binary): 255.0.0.0, 11111111.00000000.00000000.00000000.
Numbers of possible networks and hosts per network: 126 nets (2 to the power of 7-2) 16,777,214 hosts per net (2 to the power of 24-2).

Address Class: B.
First octet range (decimal): 128 to 191.
First octet bits: 10000000 to 10111111.
Network and Host parts of an address: N.N.H.H.
Default subnet mask (decimal and binary): 255.255.0.0, 11111111.11111111.00000000.00000000.
Numbers of possible networks and hosts per network: 16,382 nets (2 to the power of 14-2) 65,534 hosts per net (2 to the power of 16-2).

Address Class: C.
First octet range (decimal): 192 to 223.
First octet bits: 11000000 to 11011111.
Network and Host parts of an address: N.N.N.H.
Default subnet mask (decimal and binary): 255.255.255.0, 11111111.11111111.11111111.00000000.
Numbers of possible networks and hosts per network: 2,097.150 nets (2 to the power of 21-2) 254 hosts per net (2 to the power of 8-2) .

Address Class: D.
First octet range (decimal): 224 to 239.
First octet bits: 11100000 to 11101111.
Network and Host parts of an address: Not for commercial use as a host.

Address Class: E.
First octet range (decimal): 240 to 255.
First octet bits: 11110000 to 11111111.
Network and Host parts of an address: Not for commercial use as a host.

Note: All zeros (0) and all ones (1) are invalid host addresses.
